intro: Godetia bottae var. deflexa, commonly known as the dwarf godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange. It typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of small, vibrant flowers. The leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
